term.element: This code indicates no errors, this state can be equated to an idle state.
This code indicates a notice. A notice is an informative message that does not imply an error or warning, nor a situation that should be handled; it can be considered as statistical data.
This code indicates a message. A message is an informative message that is addressed to somebody, although it does not imply an error or warning, it was issued to a receiving party.

This code indicates a warning Warnings are informative data that indicate a potential problem, although they do not imply an error, they indicate a potential problem or an issue that should be addressed at least at a later stage.

This code indicates an error. Errors indicate that something prevented an operation from being performed, this does not necessarily mean that the whole process is halted, but that the results of an operation were not be as expected.
This code indicates a fatal error. Fatal errors result in stopping the whole process: in this case the error will prevent other operations from being performed and the whole process should be halted.

This code indicates a bug. Bugs, as opposed to errors, result from internal causes independant from external factors. A bug indicates that an operation will never execute as stated, it does not necessarily mean that it is fatal, but rather that the behaviour of an operation does not correspond to its declaration.
Case and accent not matching operator (for strings).
Prefix matching operator: starts with (for strings) with case and accent insensitive comparaison.
Content matching operator: contains (for strings) with case and accent insensitive comparaison.
Suffix matching operator: ends with (for strings) with case and accent insensitive comparaison.
Less than or equal or smaller than or equal operator.
Greater or equal or larger or equal operator.
Range inclusive operator, the valid range includes the limits.
Range exclusive operator, the valid range excludes the limits.
Belongs to set operator, the value must match at least one of the list of options.
Not in set operator, the value must not match any of the list of options.
Match all operator, the value must match all of the list of options.
Not all match operator, the value must not match all of the list of options.
Operator not AND, represents the ! (A && B) operator.
Operator not OR, represents the ! (A || B) operator.
This type represents a wildcard, it qualifies an attribute that can take any type of value.
This type defines an integer signed numeric value of an indeterminate precision.
This type defines an floating point signed numeric value of an indeterminate precision.

This type defines a switch that can take two values: ON and OFF. By default we assume it to to be represented by a number in which 0 is OFF and any other value is ON. Other valid representations may be yes/no, true/false.
This type represents a sequence of bytes. It is equivalent to the string type, except that the string can hold elements of any value, while the string type holds only text elements.

This type represents a date in the form of a hours, minutes and seconds YYYYMMDD string in which missing elements should be omitted. This means that if we don't know the day we can express that date as YYYYMM and if we don't know the month we can express it as YYYY. This type is functionally identical to the string type, except that its elements can only be digits and their structure is known.

This type represents a date and time which is a combination of the date string type followed by a structure of three elements representing the hours, minutes and seconds separated by colons, YYYYMMDD HHMMSS. Missing elements are omitted, this means that if you don't have the minutes you would have YYYYMMDD HH and if you don't have the time it would become and act as a date string type. This type is functionally identical to the string type, except that its elements can only be digits and their structure is known.
This type represents a regular expression or grep pattern string, it is used to perform complex pattern selections in strings.
This type defines a 32 bit signed integer, this number ranges from −2,147,483,648 to 2,147,483,647.
This type defines a 64 bit signed integer, this number ranges from −9,223,372,036,854,775,808 to 9,223,372,036,854,775,807.
This type represents the reference to a term object, term identifiers are by definition binary strings.
This type represents the reference to a node object, node identifiers are by definition integers.
This type represents the reference to an edge object, edge identifiers are by definition integers.
This type represents the reference to a tag object, tag identifiers are by definition integers.
This type represents the primitive meta data type, it is a generalised metadata type.
This type represents the PHP serialised data format. This type is functionally identical to the string type, except that the contents are encoded.
This type represents the JSON encoded data format. This type is functionally identical to the string type, except that the contents are encoded.
This type represents the XML encoded data format. This type is functionally identical to the string type, except that the contents are encoded.
This type represents the SVG encoded data format. This type is functionally identical to the XML type, except that the contents represent an encoded vector image file.
This data type refers to a structure, it implies that the attribute to which it refers to is a container of other attributes that will hold the actual data.

This type represents a string attribute that can be expressed in several languages. It is implemented as a list of elements in which the index represents the language code and the value represents the string in that language. There cannot be two elements with the same language code and the element which is not related to any language has the 0 index.
This type represents a native time-stamp data type, it holds the date, time and milliseconds.
This represents the enumeration data type, or a single string element of an enumerated set or controlled vocabulary.
This represents the enumerated set data type, or a list of string elements of an enumerated set or controlled vocabulary.
This type indicates that the element is required, which means that it must be present in the object. If this type is missing, it means that the element is optional.

This type applies mostly to enumerated sets, it indicates that the attribute is restricted to an enumerated set. If this type is missing, it means that the attribute may take values not belonging to the enumerated set.

This type indicates that the element is computed, which means that it is automatically filled usually when committing the object. If this type is missing, it means that the attribute must be explicitly set.

This type indicates that the element is locked, which means that it is not modifiable. This means that the value cannot be changed once the object has been committed. If this type is missing, it means that the attribute can be explicitly modified.

This type indicates that the attribute is a list of values, which means that the attribute is an array of elements of the provided data type. If this type is missing, it means that the attribute is a scalar element.
This type indicates an incoming relationship, in other words, all the relationships that point to the current object.
This type indicates an outgoing relationship, in other words, all the relationships that originate from the current object.
This type indicates all relationships, both incoming and outgoing.

This type represents the MongoId data type, when serialised it will be encoded into the following structure:
  • type: Will contain this constant.
  • data: Will contain the HEX string ID.

This type represents the MongoCode data type, when serialised it will be encoded into the following structure:
  • code: The javascript code string.
  • scope: The list of key/value pairs.

An entry point of an ontology. This kind represents a door or entry point of an ontology. It can be either the node from which the whole graph or tree originates from, or a node that represents a specific thematic entry point. In general, such objects will be used as elements of an index to an ontology.

A feature or attribute of an object that can be described or measured. This kind defines a feature, property or attribute of an object that can be described or measured. This kind of node will generally be found as a leaf of the structure describing an object. Plant height is a plant characteristic that belongs to the category of morphological traits: the latter is not a feature, while plant height is.

A method or variation of an object's feature measurement. This kind of node is required whenever an object's feature can be measured in different ways or with different workflows, without becoming a different feature. Plant height is an attribute of a plant which can be measured after a month or at flowering time; the attribute is the same, but the method is different.

The scale or unit in which a measurement is expressed in. This kind of node describes in what unit or scale a measurement is expressed in. Plant height may be measured in centimeters or inches, as well as in intervals or finite categories.

An element of a controlled vocabulary. This kind describes a controlled vocabulary element. Objects of this kind derive from scale nodes and represent the valid choices of enumeration and enumerated set scale nodes. An ISO 3166 country code could be considered an enumeration node.

A metadata instance. In general, ontology elements represent metadata, in some cases they may represent actual data: an instance is an ontology element that represents the metadata and data of an object. An ISO 3166 country code can be considered an enumeration that constitutes the metadata for the country it represents, but if you store the country data in that element, this may become also an instance, because it represents the object it defines.
This kind of represents a namespace, semantic group or identifiers space. Objects of this kind will generally be used to group identifiers.
This kind represents a predicate, or element which connects subject and object vertices into a relationship.

This kind of term represents a predicate which relates two terms in both directions. By default, relationships are directional, that is they originate from the subject towards the object, but not in the opposite direction: this kind of predicate, instead, does not have the concept of direction, the relationship flows in both directions.
Text field control allowing input on one line excluding return characters.
Text area control allowing input on several lines including return characters.
Single select group allowing the choice of one item among a list of predefined values.
Multiple select group allowing the choice of one or more items among a list of predefined values.
Radio control group of two controls which allows one of the two to be on. By default this control must return the value of one of the two radios.
Single checkbox control which can be either selected or not. By default this control must either return a value or not.
